noun.description: (A) Any of various substances resembling lead, especially molybdenite (molybdenum disulphide). Now chiefly historical. (b) The metallic element molybdenum. Now chiefly historical.

origin: Mid 17th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin molybdaena a kind of lead ore, also as the name of a plant from ancient Greek μολύβδαινα a kind of lead ore, angler's plummet from μόλυβδος lead + -αινα, suffix forming nouns.
